triageFlags.title: Excessive Debt-to-Income Ratio
triageFlags.description: The applicant's DTI ratio is significantly above the allowable threshold for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to unsustainable affordability.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, Tier C applicants must have a DTI ratio of 35% or less. The applicant's DTI ratio of 440% is far beyond this limit, indicating severe affordability issues.

triageFlags.title: Sub-Prime Credit Score
triageFlags.description: The applicant's credit score places them in the sub-prime category, requiring stricter lending criteria.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider declining the application or imposing additional conditions if proceeding.
triageFlags.reasoning: The credit score of 575 categorizes the applicant as sub-prime (Tier C), which necessitates stricter lending criteria, including a lower DTI ratio and potentially higher deposit requirements.

content.reasoning: The applicant's DTI ratio significantly exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for their credit tier, and their credit score indicates a high-risk profile. These factors combined present an unacceptable level of financial risk.
